10) Lastly, contra one @bgurley’s specific points, term sheets don’t have to be evil
https://t.co/ilyhIJLxUa
9) ...it feels good to be vindicated & know we're entering fertile grounds for fundamental investing & superior returns for our investors.
8) While I never want to rejoice in the face of a struggling venture industry & entrepreneurial environment…
7) In this case, we say "short term wrong, long term right”. #shorttermwronglongtermright #boringVChastags
6) We also know that we must hold our conviction because ultimately profits matter & fundamental investing wins out.
5) At @FoundationCap, we label ourselves "short term wrong" when we feel like we missed one of these opportunities.
4) In times like 2014/5, hard to maintain conviction that profits matter as those that had the foresight to exit early booked huge gains.
3) ...rather than a momentum investor (get in on rising momentum and don't let the door hit you on the way out).
2) I classify myself as a fundamental investor (looking for sustainable, long-term differentiation & ability to generate EBITDA)…
